audios.au: This is the diagram of an ECAS system for a semitrailer equipped with a lifting axle. The main components of the system are in the first place the ECAS ECU ...
which is powered via the ABS or the EBS ECU.
Further the ECAS valve block for the rear and lifting axles, which pressurizes or vents all supporting bellows ...
... as well as the lifting bellows to raise and lower the lifting axle. Only one of them is depicted here.
The actual level of the load platform is measured by only one centrally placed height sensor.
The ECAS warning lamp is switched on, as soon as the superstructure left the driving level, or in the case of a failure.

Finally, a pressure sensor detects the bellows pressure of the main axle. When this pressure exceeded a parameterized value, the lifting axle may be automatically lowered. When falling below a certain bellows pressure, it may be automatically raised.
